comment.author: 47617722@N03
comment._content:
The Twin Cottages face Mrs Macquaries Rd.  They were designed  by Walter Vernon (Government Architect).  These Arts & Craft style cottages were built in 1899  as residences for gardeners who also acted as caretakers for the Gardens. 
They are now festooned with Boston Ivy and are the home of the Friends of The Gardens who provide invaluable support to the work of the Gardens.  To the right of the cottages is an area where Friends' volunteers grow and sell plants to raise funds to support many important Gardens activities.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: It's nice to know that the cottage is still in use for a worthwhile purpose.
